result.execSummary:
This case is being appealed. If the court makes a decision in a case that a party disagrees with, the party may have the right to seek review by a higher court to determine if the trial court's decision was correct. Appeals are most often made after a trial or final decision in a case, but an appeal can also occur before a final decision.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Restitution has been paid in full by a co-defendant.  Court orders this defendant to pay sum of restitution,  to be determined as this defendant's share, to DOC and that the agent is to distribute the monies to the appropriate party.
Pursuant to Restitution Order (DOC-31) dated 01/11/2017, $600.69 represents restitution plus $0.00 restitution surcharge.

Plus supervision fees.    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.    $10 represents the mandatory statutory surcharge for 943 property crimes.   $250 represents DNA surcharge.
Co-operate with all counseling.  Complete all programs.

No contact with:  victims or co-defendants.    Not to possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substance not prescribed by authorized medical personnel.  Not to possess or consume any illegal drugs.  Not to go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any firearms or dangerous weapons or knives outside the residence or martial arts items.    Not to associate with anyone using or possessing illegal drugs.

supervisions.notes: Court orders Competency Evaluation to be forwarded to DOC (hard copy in DOC's mail basket w/ copy of Judgment of Conviction).

10:31 AM Defendant Zachary Seth Williams in court.  Roy La Barton Gay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agent Borgaro appearing from the Department of Community Corrections. 
Agent Borgaro makes statement regarding restitution. Defendant has not made payments towards restitution owed. Requested Court order a wage assignment. 
Victim makes statement regarding restitution. $589.69 still owed. 
State argues the victim is not a victim by statute and requests the victim to file a small claims matter against the defendant. 
Defendant makes statement. Informs the Court he has the money to pay the amount owed. 
Court finds it proper to transfer funds directly to victim bypassing the requirement to do so through the State. And further finds financial obligation has been finalized. 
$580.69 was provided to victim in court.
Submitted by DA's office, Re: Restitution *sent for review*
Probation review hearing on September 24, 2020 at 10:30 am.
